Package com.github.actionfx.core.annotation

Annotation Type AFXApplication

  • @Retention(RUNTIME)
@Documented
@Target(TYPE)
public @interface AFXApplication
    Annotation that can be applied to the main class of an ActionFX application for configuring it.
    Author:
    koster

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element Description
      java.lang.String mainViewId
      The ID of the main view that shall be display in the JavaFX primary stage.
      java.lang.String scanPackage
      Package name to scan for view components.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element Description
      boolean enableBeanContainerAutodetection
      Flag that determines whether the best bean container implementation shall be determined automatically.
      boolean validationApplyRequiredDecoration
      Flag that indicates, whether validation decorations for marking required fields shall be displayed.
      boolean validationApplyResultDecoration
      Flag that indicates, whether validation decorations for validation results shall be applied to controls under validation.
      ValidationMode validationGlobalMode
      Specifies the global validation mode that shall be applied on JavaFX controls that carry an validation-related annotation like AFXValidateRequired.
      int validationStartTimeoutMs
      A global timeout setting for staring a control validation after a change in a particular control occurs.

    • Element Detail

      • scanPackage

        java.lang.String scanPackage
        Package name to scan for view components.
        Returns:
        the package name to scan (sub-packages are included in the scan)

      • mainViewId

        java.lang.String mainViewId
        The ID of the main view that shall be display in the JavaFX primary stage.
        Returns:
        the ID of the main view.

      • enableBeanContainerAutodetection

        boolean enableBeanContainerAutodetection
        Flag that determines whether the best bean container implementation shall be determined automatically. Autodetection is enabled by default. If the flag is disabled, ActionFX default bean container will be internally used. In case autodetection is enabled and the module afx-spring-boot is on the classpath, the Spring container is used as ActionFX's bean container.
        Returns:
        flag that determines whether the bean container implementation shall be autodetected or not. Default is true.
        Default:
        true

      • validationGlobalMode

        ValidationMode validationGlobalMode
        Specifies the global validation mode that shall be applied on JavaFX controls that carry an validation-related annotation like AFXValidateRequired. In case a global validation mode is set via this builder, the annotations do not need to specify a validation mode anymore. This is helpful for reducing the number of attributes in validation-related annotations and ActionFX controllers.
        Returns:
        the global validation mode. Default value is ValidationMode.GLOBAL_VALIDATION_MODE_UNSPECIFIED, means, the specification of a validation mode is in responsibility of any validation-related annotation.s
        Default:
        com.github.actionfx.core.annotation.ValidationMode.GLOBAL_VALIDATION_MODE_UNSPECIFIED

      • validationApplyResultDecoration

        boolean validationApplyResultDecoration
        Flag that indicates, whether validation decorations for validation results shall be applied to controls under validation. Default is true.
        Returns:
        true, if validation decorations shall be applied to controls under validation, false otherwise.
        Default:
        true

      • validationApplyRequiredDecoration

        boolean validationApplyRequiredDecoration
        Flag that indicates, whether validation decorations for marking required fields shall be displayed. Default is true.
        Returns:
        true, if validation decorations for required fields shall be displayed for controls under validation, false otherwise.
        Default:
        true

      • validationStartTimeoutMs

        int validationStartTimeoutMs
        A global timeout setting for staring a control validation after a change in a particular control occurs. If the returned value is -1, there is no global timeout setting and the timeout value needs to be defined in all validation related annotations directly (this might make more sense in many cases). Default is -1 (no global timeout).
        Returns:
        the validation start timeout value in milliseconds, or -1, if there is no global setting for the validation start timeout.
        Default:
        -1
